newsitem.title: USA: Freeport Indonesian reserves up in 1996.
newsitem.headline: Freeport Indonesian reserves up in 1996.

text.p: Freeport-McMoRan Copper & Gold Inc said Friday proved and probable recoverable reserves of P.T. Freeport Indonesia Co, FCX's mining affiliate, added proved and probable recoverable reserves totaling about 161 million tonnes of ore in 1996.
The ore represents 4.1 billion lbs of copper, 4.9 million ounces of gold and 10.3 million ounces of silver.

Of the reserves that were added, Freeport said, about one-half resulted from initial delineation drilling at the Kucing Liar ore body while the remainder were from the Grasberg and IOZ/DOZ ore bodies.
These recoverable reserves reflect an upward adjustment to the estimated 1996 reserve additions previously reported in FCX's fourth quarter earnings release on Jan 21, it said.
Pursuant to the joint venture arrangements between FCX and the RTZ-CRA Group, RTZ-CRA has the conditional right to a 40 percent interest in newly discovered reserves.

Net of 1996 production, PT-FI's proved and probable recoverable reserves at Dec 31 totaled 2.0 billion tonnes of ore averaging 1.19 percent copper, 1.18 grams of gold per tonne and 3.80 grams of silver a tonne.
